intro: Cryptantha grandiflora var. anulata, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with a mat-forming growth habit, characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
